iio o o m o o O30 All telegrams from London to the Chancellor willbe prefixed with the word "LANGA" and a serial number, andwill be marked "following from.ii4,, A register of all "DUCHY" and "LANGA" telegramswill be kept in the Office of the Minister of Defence, WarCabinet Offices, S0-W,l, (Telephone Number Whitehall 5422,Extension 536), from whom, in the case of "LANCA" telegrams,transmitting Departments will obtain the appropriate "LANOA"Serial number,,5C Telegrams between the Chancellor and other Missions'etcr in the Far East will not bear a prefix, but will bemarked l!following from the Chancellor of the Duchy of lancaster,,*00" or "Following for the Chancellor of the duchy of Lancaster,,.,,.,", Telegrams from the Chancellor of the duchy of Lancaster to other Missions etc in the Far East,when repeated to London, will be marked for the appropriate department,,6,j The Chancellor has been asked when telegraphingabout matters of general concern which cannot properly beaddressed to a single Government Department, to mark histelegrams "Following for Secretary, War Cabinet". The Secretarwill then see that they are considered and answered. Thearrangements for distribution will be the same as for othertelegrams.S. This paper supersedes W.P.(G)(4l) 72)Transmission and Marking of Telegrams.1, Telegrams will be transmitted through the ForeignOffice, India Office, Burma Office, Colonial Office, a service Department, etc., as convenience of geography or subject matter may dictate;,2,, All telegrams from the Chancellor to London willbo prefixed with the word "DUCHY" and a serial number, andmarked "Following for. 0
Distribution of Conies (London).7. Transmitting Departments will send advance copiesof all "DUCHY" and "LANCA" telegrams, and of repeatedtelegrams (cf, paragraph 5), as follows:-Department receiving or sending message.3 copies.LieutP-Colonel E. I. G. Jacob,Office of the Minister of Defence,War Cabinet Offices.3 copies.Mr0 J.E, Coulson,War Cabinet Offices.2 copies.80 For the rest, and subject to paragraph 9 below,the distribution to be given in London to telegrams to andfrom the Chancellor will be decided by the Departmentreceiving or sending the message, or to which the message isrepeated, which will instruct the transmitting Departmentaccordingly. The distribution given to each telegram willbe shown on the copies.9C If the Chancellor wishes a telegram to be givenWar Cabinet distribution Immediately on its receipt inthis country, he will add the prefix "CABIN".. Thetransmitting Department will then give the telegram WarCabinet distribution without reference to the Departmentto which the telegram is addressed.(Signed) E.E.BRIDGES.Great George Street, S.W.1.
